comments:
Eclipse 3.1 final release on Windows 2000.  Reproduced on two PCs using new 
installs of Eclipse with all default settings, with a new workspace and new 
project.

If I have the javadoc for a Jar set to a location on my PC, when I view 
the javadoc for something like String by hitting F1 and selecting Javadoc 
for java.lang.String it views perfectly in the Help View window.  However 
if I then click the Show in External Window button, the following popup 
error appears:
An Exception occurred while launching help.  Refer to the log file located 
at C:\Test\TestWsp\.metadata\.log

The .log entry for this exception is:

!MESSAGE An exception occurred while launching help.  Check the log at 
C:\Test\TestWsp\.metadata\.log

For the record the javadoc location path was created by Eclipse as 
file:/C:/jdk/docs/api/

The same error happens if the javadoc is in a local jar file.  Specifying a web 
site location for the javadoc is not acceptable because most of my javadoc 
isn't hosted on a website and exists only on my PC.

Move to Platform/Help (not sure this is the correct component, please reassign
if necessary, thanks)
